intro: Liabum selleanum, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its striking clusters of yellow, pendant flowers that bloom in spring. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Liabum selleanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
